posts.post_content:
I don´t see the drawback as a big problem. Getting him out on the 4th turn your opponent will do everything to remove him a fast as possible.  
He is just a too great threat to leave him on the board to long. Even if your opponent speculates with the thought that the Presecutor prevents him from loosing, he will never know if you have some sort of sacrifice Outlet like [Bone Splinters](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bone Splinters) or any devour-creature on your hand to nullify the effect.  
  
The Presecutor adds a lot of fun and a whole dose of adrenalin to the game, making him a 5/5 to me.

Posted By: Urbar (1/31/2010 2:50:43 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This must be one of the most powerful undercosted creatures ever.  
A 6/6 flampler for four mana? Yes, please  
  
And the drawback is comparably a rather ridiculous one:  
It might sound like much, but it will really only bother you very little once you already took apart your opponent anyways.  
  
Getting rid of your own permanents, especially if you're running black, is one of the easiest things to do.  
There are in general a lot of removal spells you could use on him like [Terminate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminate), [Path to Exile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Path to Exile), [Journey to Nowhere](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Journey to Nowhere) or [Oblivion Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oblivion Ring).  
And for monoblack decks in particular there are plenty of cards even in Standard right now which will let you sacrifice him like [Bone Splinters](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bone Splinters), [Gatekeeper of Malakir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gatekeeper of Malakir), [Fleshbag Marauder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fleshbag Marauder), [Vampire Aristocrat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Aristocrat), [Eldrazi Monument](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eldrazi Monument), or any Jund creature with Devour like Glutto... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Eved (1/31/2010 4:48:28 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Do I think he's good? Of course he is. The problem is, today's standard best standard deck - Jund - can't fit him in because of the 4 CMC. [Bloodbraid Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodbraid Elf) can't cascade into it, which really disrupts the tempo Jund is supposed to create, but aside from the fact that he's un-cascadable, he's a fantastic beatstick. That being said, he doesn't deserve the $20-30 pricetag he's got going.  
  
Can another deck work with him? Definitely. Will it succeed? Unlikely. It dies to removal, like everything else, and when your hand has nothing but the sacrifice engines that get around [Vines of Vastwood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vines of Vastwood) and [Canopy Cover](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Canopy Cover), such as [Gatekeeper of Malakir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gatekeeper of Malakir), [Bone Splinters](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bone Splinters) and [Fleshbag Marauder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fleshbag Marauder), it seems like a much less attractive niche deck to try. Only time will tell to see if the reverse of [Platinum Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Platinum Angel) will see play.
posts.html:
Do I think he's good? Of course he is. The problem is, today's standard best standard deck - Jund - can't fit him in because of the 4 CMC. Bloodbraid Elf can't cascade into it, which really disrupts the tempo Jund is supposed to create, but aside from the fact that he's un-cascadable, he's a fantastic beatstick. That being said, he doesn't deserve the $20-30 pricetag he's got going.

Can another deck work with him? Definitely. Will it succeed? Unlikely. It dies to removal, like everything else, and when your hand has nothing but the sacrifice engines that get around Vines of Vastwood and Canopy Cover, such as Gatekeeper of Malakir, Bone Splinters and Fleshbag Marauder, it seems like a much less attractive niche deck to try. Only time will tell to see if the reverse of Platinum Angel will see play.

posts.post_content: I think this could be interestin in a red and black deck with [bazaar trader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=bazaar trader) using the demon body at first and then later game switching the effect with your opponnent. It might be interesting to have them make the trumping effect based on which card entered play first.

posts.post_content:
Great tempo in MBC with this guy:  
  
Turn 1: [Duress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Duress)  
Turn 2: [Smother](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Smother)/[Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade), [Sign in Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sign in Blood), maybe [Gatekeeper of Malakir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gatekeeper of Malakir) (almost never though),  
Turn 3: [Vampire Nighthawk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nighthawk), [Gatekeeper of Malakir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gatekeeper of Malakir) kicked or [Fleshbag Marauder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fleshbag Marauder)  
Turn 4: [Abyssal Persecutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Abyssal Persecutor) or [Tendrils of Corruption](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tendrils of Corruption)  
Turn 5: [Mind Sludge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Sludge) or [Bloodwitch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodwitch)  
  
You'll likely draw into into another Gatekeeper or Fleshbag, or even a Tendrils before you need to sac the Persecutor. Sign in Blood is especially helpful here. I've managed to put two Persecutors out one after the other with no concern, managed to remove both of them with two Gatekeepers when the guy was at -8.  
  
Persecutor really makes MBC competitive. Baneslayer has to deal with plenty of removal and a Malakir Bloodwitch in sideboar... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Great tempo in MBC with this guy:

Turn 1: Duress
Turn 2: Smother/Doom Blade, Sign in Blood, maybe Gatekeeper of Malakir (almost never though),
Turn 3: Vampire Nighthawk, Gatekeeper of Malakir kicked or Fleshbag Marauder
Turn 4: Abyssal Persecutor or Tendrils of Corruption
Turn 5: Mind Sludge or Bloodwitch

You'll likely draw into into another Gatekeeper or Fleshbag, or even a Tendrils before you need to sac the Persecutor. Sign in Blood is especially helpful here. I've managed to put two Persecutors out one after the other with no concern, managed to remove both of them with two Gatekeepers when the guy was at -8.

Persecutor really makes MBC competitive. Baneslayer has to deal with plenty of removal and a Malakir Bloodwitch in sideboar... (see all)
